definition: to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: February brings the rain , thaws the frozen ponds again .
sentences.chinese: 二月帶來雨水，使池塘水面冰層融解。

sentences.english: Drink after melt it in about 50 ml hot water.
sentences.chinese: 用約50毫升熱開水融解後服用。

sentences.english: This operation is intended to dissolve all the alloying additions in solution and hold them there at room temperature.
sentences.chinese: 本操作意圖是在融解狀態下融化入所有添加合金。

sentences.english: In the latter case, the configuration might cascade or be reconciled into a final result.
sentences.chinese: 在後一種情況下，配置可以級聯或融解到最終結果中。

sentences.english: The iciest hearts on the planet can be thawed by the heaven's burnished flame.
sentences.chinese: 在行星上的最冰的中心能被磨咒罵訊息的天堂融解。

sentences.english: Let the warmth of understanding and the awareness of your worth thaw your emotions.
sentences.chinese: 讓體諒的溫暖及自我價值的覺察融解你的情緒。

sentences.english: Solid-metal embrittlement by cadmium can occur at temperatures below the cadmium melting point.
sentences.chinese: 低於鎘的融解點溫度時會出現故態金屬的鎘脆化。

definition: to melt/to thaw/to dissolve/to blend into/to combine/to fuse
to spread out after being diluted or melted/to dissolve into a liquid
to freeze/to solidify/to congeal/fig. with rapt attention
